top2FollowedAccounts.note:
r/startrek: The Next Generation

Star Trek news and discussion. No slash fic…

Maybe a little slash fic.

New to Star Trek and wondering where to start?

Rules

1 Be constructive

All posts/comments must be thoughtful and balanced.

2 Be welcoming

It is important that everyone from newbies to OG Trekkers feel welcome, no matter their gender, sexual orientation, religion or race.

3 Be truthful

All posts/comments must be factually accurate and verifiable. We are not a place for gossip, rumors, or manipulative or misleading content.

4 Be nice

If a polite way cannot be found to phrase what it is you want to say, don’t say anything at all. Insulting or disparaging remarks about any human being are expressly not allowed.

5 Spoilers

Utilize the spoiler system for any and all spoilers relating to the most recently-aired episodes, as well as previews for upcoming episodes. There is no formal spoiler protection for episodes/films after they have been available for approximately one week.

6 Keep on-topic

All submissions must be directly about the Star Trek franchise (the shows, movies, books etc.). Off-topic discussions are welcome at c/quarks.

Hello there. Somehow, Star Wars memes have returned. It’s not a trap, this is where the fun begins.

Technical note: if you’re coming from another star system and are getting a “Subscription pending” message when trying to dock, that’s just the console being slow to display the right message. The connection is already established. (Probably.)

==========

IMPORTANT

Do not post the “good friend” or similar copypasta

==========

Special days!

Friday and weekends: Caption contest. An image will be pinned, and we shall make captions for it and post them in the comments.

Wednesday: Theme day. We have Droids day, EU day, poem day, aliens day… Let the pinned post guide you. Memes with the theme are preferred.

==========

Other universes to visit:

!lotrmemes@midwest.social

!risa@startrek.website

Separatist systems:

!didyoueverhear@lemmy.world

!prequelmemes@lemmy.ml

!prequelmemes@lemmy.world

Oh hey some real SW content for a change (perhaps):

!star_wars@lemmy.world

!starwars@lemmy.ml

!starwars@lemmy.world

!starwarstelevision@lemmy.world

!cassianandor@feddit.nl

==========

Our galactic citizens have requested more specific rules, so here are a few.

The general idea is, if you’re looking here for rules, you’re probably someone who doesn’t need to have them spelled out. You’re fine. But anyway:

  1. This is a community for Star Wars memes. This means typically screenshots of Star Wars media with some text or context that’s meant to be funny and/or thoughtful. All SW media is welcome: movies, games, comic books, fanart… Other kinds of content, like video links or meta memes (about this community, or Lemmy), are fine as well, just keep it on topic.

  2. We are all friends here, and love (sometimes love to hate) Star Wars. Be nice to each other.

  3. As fans of fictional media, we can be passionate. If you very strongly disagree with something or someone, take a deep breath before reacting. Anger leads to the dark side!

  4. Everything in Star Wars has happened a long time ago, in a galaxy far away, and it’s a rich universe of millions of words and millions of years of history. So current Earthly matters really shouldn’t concern us here. In other words, leave politics, philosophies and convictions behind the door. This applies even if it’s about something related to Star Wars.

  5. Original content is preferred. Reposts are fine, just please limit to a maximum of 3 per day, per citizen. It is recommended, but not required, to mark original memes as (OC) and reposts as (repost).

  6. Local mods are the Jedi council. They may take actions that are necessary to maintain peace and stability of the Republic, even beyond the rules outlined here. Follow their guidance.

  7. Regular rules of the Lemmy.world instance apply.

top2Posts.content:
Knowing the data warehouse cost for building a dbt project has really been bugging us recently, so a colleague made a proof of concept to see the cost after running dbt.

It records the bytes billed from BigQuery to a file after dbt build finishes, and then calculates the cost based on the current cost of BigQuery ($5 per TB).

I’ve written a blog post about it:

https://medium.com/inthepipeline/how-to-track-your-dbt-projects-bigquery-data-warehouse-costs-in-dbt-a-poc-716068b1e2c3

Is this something folk are interested in?

#DataOps #BigQuery #DBT #DataEngineering #AnalyticsEngineering

media_attachments.description:
Black Friday
James Copeland

Oot behind a lorry, 
Peyin nae heed,
Ablow a doubledecker, 
A poor wean deid. 

Perra worn sannies, 
Wee durrty knees, 
Heh, erra polis, 
Stand back please! 

Lookit the conductriss. 
Face as white as chalk, 
Heh, see the driver but 
Cannae even talk. 

Anyone a witness? 
Na, we niver saw. 
Glad ah’m no the polis 
Goin tae tell its maw. 

Weemen windae-hingin 
Herts in their mooth, 
It’s no oor close, Lizzie 
Oh Gawdstrewth! 

Screams on the landin, 
Twa closes doon, 
It’s no wee Hughie! 
Poor Nellie Broon. 

Phone up the shipyard. 
Oh, what a shame! 
Yes, we'll inform him, 
Please repeat the name. 

See Big Hughie, 
Jokin wi the squad, 
Better knock off, Heug, 
Oh dear God. 

Whit – no his laddie? 
Aw, bloody hell! 
D’ye see Hughie’s face but, 
He’s just a boy himsel.

top2FollowedAccounts.note:
c/photography is a community centered on the practice of amateur and professional photography. You can come here to discuss the gear, the technique and the culture related to the art of photography. You can also share your work, appreciate the others’ and constructively critique each others work.

Please, be sure to read the rules before posting.

THE RULES

  1. Be nice to each other

This Lemmy Community is open to civil, friendly discussion about our common interest, photography. Excessively rude, mean, unfriendly, or hostile conduct is not permitted.

  1. Keep content on topic

All discussion threads must be photography related such as latest gear or art news, gear acquisition advices, photography related questions, etc…

  1. No politics or religion

This Lemmy Community is about photography and discussion around photography, not religion or politics.

  1. No classified ads or job offers

All is in the title. This is a casual discussion community.

  1. No spam or self-promotion

One post, one photo in the limit of 3 pictures in a 24 hours timespan. Do not flood the community with your pictures. Be patient, select your best work, and enjoy.

  1. If you want contructive critiques, use [Critique Wanted] in your title.

  2. Flair NSFW posts (nudity, gore, …)

  3. Do not share your portfolio (instagram, flickr, or else…)

The aim of this community is to invite everyone to discuss around your photography. If you drop everything with one link, this become pointless. Portfolio posts will be deleted. You can however share your portfolio link in the comment section if another member wants to see more of your work.

top2Posts.content:
After a busy couple of months at work, I have finally managed to squeeze in some dog photography.

Last weekend I swung past some yard dog trials being run at the local agricultural show. I'd never been to a yard trial before and I wasn't prepared for how different it would be to photograph (compared to the sheepdog trials I'm used to).

The smaller field allowed me to get much closer to the action, but the dogs were faster, and right in among the sheep, making it difficult to keep them in frame.

Nevertheless, out of over 4,000 photos from the day, I managed to get a few that I'm pretty happy with. Now I just need to find the time to edit them and get them uploaded...

#Dogs #DogsOfMastodon #SheepDogs #Sheep #SheepdogTrials
#WorkingDogs
#Photography

account.note: Engineer and photography enthusiast. Mostly taking pictures of dogs, cars and landscapes.

media_attachments.description:
A black and tan kelpie is standing on top of a group of sheep held within a pen. It is a sunny day, there are gum trees in the background and portions of the steel fencing used to construct the pen can be seen within the shot. The dog is calm but alert, carefully watching his master (who is standing just out of shot) for the next instruction. The sheep seem completely unfazed by the dog standing on them, with not one of the sheep even looking at the dog.

While the subject of the photo is the dog, it would be remiss of me to not mention how good the sheep look. The sunlight makes their fleeces look particularly golden and they seem extremely healthy and well cared for.

media_attachments.description:
4 artworks of creepy women by me
1. Watercolor Painting by me of two ghost girls holding the hands of two shadowy children-like wraiths in a forest.
2. A piece inspired by a piece of AI art that was circulating around. A woman in black stands in the center of a room with a bed behind her and a creepy painting on the wall.
3. My painting OUR LADY OF PERPETUAL HAUNTINGS which has a nun standing on a full moon with a haunted house on it, while storm clouds swirl around and behind her. She's holding a Ouija board planchette and ghosts are emanating from it/her. Two red curtains frame the scene and a black bee sits on the upper left of one of them.
4. Pastel & colored pencil surreal/stylized drawing of a woman with black eyes and blue skin. She's wearing a green dress with an orange belt and a shawl. Green hills rise behind her with skeletal trees and a full moon in the sky.

Four artworks of ghosts I made
1. A ghost saying "shhhh" (or flipping you off, your choice)
2. A ghost bending over to see if he can see his reflection in a broken mirror
3. A ghost adding a rock to a wall
4. A ghostly bride

media_attachments.description:
I already had a stylophone and this seemed like the perfect compliment to make it a fun and approachable way to make and maybe record some simple electronic tunes. I had no idea what I was starting, I wish someone had warned me. It does what it says on the tin, it’s fun and it’s easy to make some really pleasant beats, if a bit limited. That’s where the problems began. Now I’m hyperfixating on synthesizers, staying up until 2am researching and comparing and watching review videos on fm subtractive synthesis and analog vs digital, mono and poly and midi controllers and custom patches, keyboards, sequencers, samplers, rhythm machines and noise generators. And then the pedals. Oh god, the pedals.
If you’ve got too much money and too much free time and you don’t know how to spend either, this is the product for you. 5 stars.

top2Posts.content:
So I’m at the funeral of an #artist with a particular love of #flowers She cared and painted on this planet for nine decades and more.

At the moment her family returned her to the earth a winter active buff-tailed #bumblebee queen weaved gently and unnoticed through the people gathered. Through the grief.

She paused on heather flowering on a nearby grave before continuing on her busy way.

How lovely to have a bumblebee carry you on. Creating flowers along the way.

card.title: COVID Competent Provider Recommendation Form.
card.description:
The COVID-19 Pandemic has left ~17-69 million people in the United States and ~108-431 million people worldwide chronically ill due to Long COVID and its Associated Conditions (LCAC). With no mandate for providers to stay abreast of Long COVID research, with no national screening or treatment protocols for Long COVID, and with limited health care personnel trained in post-viral illnesses, especially those appearing in Long COVID like Dysautonomia, ME/CFS, Mast Cell Activation Syndrome and many others, patients have faced barrier after barrier when seeking care. The failure of healthcare workers to stay abreast of Long COVID research and educate themselves on the LCAC's to assist the inevitable tens to hundreds of patients they will have with Long COVID has created delays in referrals to specialists and treatment, disease progression, inability to access assistance programs because of lack of documentation, and of course the stress and provocation of mental health challenges faced due to medical gaslighting and by providers who simple do not care, blame anxiety or psychosomatic issues or fire patients. 

 The COVID-19 Longhauler Advocacy Project is a Long COVID Non-Profit whose mission is to advance the understanding of Long COVID and expedite solutions and assistance to Longhaulers and their families through advocacy, education, research and support. The purpose of this form is for for you, the community, to recommend the providers who are what we are calling "COVID Competent" so that we can expedite access to quality care for Longhaulers, preserving spoons and hopefully preventing or limiting exposure to medical gaslighting and excessive costs from chasing numerous providers.

The current list of recommended doctors can be found below.
 http://bit.ly/OFFICIAL-LIST-COVIDCompetentProviders 
 *Please Note: we do NOT endorse any of the providers listed, nor do we have personal experience with them. All submissions are made voluntarily by community members with a patient-provider relationship or experience. If you see a provider off of this list, there is no guarantee you may have the same experience as the person who nominated them. the COVID-19 Longhauler Advocacy Project hold no responsibility or liability for your use of a provider on this list. However, if you disagree with the recommendation of a provider on this list, we would like to hear from you regarding the details of your experience. If there are providers participating in controversial treatment or misinformation listed, please immediately bring this to our attention.**

We are looking ONLY for health care providers who: 
1- Are aware of and believe in Long COVID and your issues/ complaints
2- Are, in your opinion, at least a 6/10 in their understanding of Long COVID
3- Understand the role Long COVID in the development of Dysautonomia, ME/CFS/ MCAS and others.
4- Were not fully up to date on Long COVID or its associated conditions, but admitted that and made an effort to research and learn about it for your next appointment, and there was improvement and a willingness to learn.
5- Those who help coordinate your care with other providers and believe in comprehensive systemic care.
6- Those who are willing to treat you via sending you for testing, imaging, prescribing medications etc. vs telling you to wait it out or it will get better on its own.
*if your provider does not seem like the description above, please do not enter them on this form*

Panel 3:  The Designer and Developer are dragged kicked and screaming through a big imposing door. The Designer shouts "I'M SORRY! media_attachments.description:
Iain Crichton Smith
“Two Girls Singing”

It neither was the words nor yet the tune.
Any tune would have done and any words.
Any listener or no listener at all.

As nightingales in rocks or a child crooning
in its own world of strange awakening
or larks for no reason but themselves.

So on the bus through late November running
by yellow lights tormented, darkness falling,
the two girls sang for miles and miles together

and it wasn’t the words or tune. It was the singing.
It was the human sweetness in that yellow,
the unpredicted voices of our kind.

card.description:
@aras Ok, while the timeline is not useful for giving any kind of overview over what are big vs tiny allocation problems, it *is* useful for stumbling upon allocations I might not be aware of, and the stacktrace feature makes it easy to identify the cause.

I found out I had lots of small allocations from dictionaries boxing my structs. Fixed by implementing IEquatable<T>.

media_attachments.description:
Dude! What a fine subject for a discourse. Only we have no Thackeray to do the discoursing. Let's discuss him anyhow.

What is a dude? Does he belong in the economy of nature?

The lexicographers and encyclopedists have not enlightened us on the score. As they omitted no other living species it is fair to conclude that the dude did not exist until recently.

They mention "fop," but comparison fails to sustain a sufficient energy.

Thrown upon our own diagnosis we must postulate a dude as human; seeing that he lives and moves and has his being as humans have.

Apostulate as human implies tbat he possesses consciousness, it not intelligence.

This is consciousness must be self-cognizant. Here, then, our study becomes feasible, self-cognizance being established as an elementary (not to say the only elementary) quality of the dude he is entitled to speak for himself. Then thus would he speak:

A dude is man evoluted into his highest form.

--The Tennesseean, 27 March 1887
